text: Harold Fitzgerald Hogue, Sr. (November 13, 1967 â€” January 23, 2024) was an American professional wrestler. He was known for his time when he wrestled in World Championship Wrestling (WCW) from 1990 to 2001. He competed in WCW under the ring names Ice Train and M.I. Smooth. Hogue retired from professional wrestling in 2001 soon after the WCW was bought by the World Wrestling Federation (WWF). On January 23, 2024, it was announced by Diamond Dallas Page that Hogue has died. ==Championships== *Catch Wrestling Association **Catch Cup (1995) *Pro Wrestling Illustrated **He was ranked #221 of the best 500 singles wrestlers in the PWI 500 in 1993. ==References== ==Other websites== *Ice Train's profile on the Internet Wrestling Database Category:1967 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American professional wrestlers Category:Sportspeople from Atlanta
title: Ice Train (wrestler)
